Se dovessi descrivere con una parola Half-Life, direi: Incredibile!! Nonostante gli anni che ha questo gioco vi posso assicurare che riuscirà a colpirvi e a prendervi dall'inizio alla fine. Se state cercando un gioco con una trama complessa, ben studiato ma anche divertente, questo gioco fa per voi, se invece ci volete anche un po di grafica vi consiglio il seguito (Half-Life 2). L'unica vera differenza che ho notato fra i due, apparte la grafica, è la difficoltà, il primo è molto più difficile anche giocato in semplice, non che il 2 sia banale. Consigliato vivamente! voto: 9,5. Mezzo punto l'ho tolto per la difficoltà un tantino esagerata in alcune parti e per il tempo di caricamento del gioco, che ci mette un pochino di troppo.

Half-Life, o Vida-Media en Español, cuenta el inicio de la carrera del Doc.Walter White, antes de empezar a hacer metanfetamina, Walter se encargaba de llevar queso roñizo a un rayo laser que acabaria con la destruccion total de Mesa Negra (Un pequeño restaurante que disponia de una I+D que superaba a la NASA), Walter aqui llamado Morgan Freeman tendra que superar ordas de yonkis zombis, militares superdopados y cientificos/cocineros, con la ayuda de Barnie Stinson y sus 300 clones repartidos por toda la instalacion de Mesa Negra. Armado con su ilustre palanca que solo la utilizara al principio del juego, y despues encontrara un monton de variedad de armas que ni el Borderlans podria albergar. "Preparate para cocinar, prepara la LIBERTAD"

A classic game from the late 1990s PC gaming scene, Half-Life made a huge impact on both the FPS (first-person shooter) genre as well as action games in general with a strong emphasis on story, setting, and continuity. While previous FPSs had focused more on providing players with concentrated experiences of fast-paced gameplay, Half-Life took players on a journey, placing them in the midst of a variety of events and scenarios, and offering a mix of shooting, platforming and puzzle gameplay. Perhaps most uniquely, Half-Life eschewed cut-scenes, instead unveiling it's story while the player is in control, helping to maintain a sense of immersion. It also places the player in large, continuous environments and essentially all takes place continuously in the day of a single person, again, features which faciliated a sense of immersion. Half-Lifes original take on game design changed the FPS genre irrevocably, and now it is uncommon to find an FPS in which there is not at least some attempt to create a sense of story and setting. Series such as Halo, Call of Duty and BIoshock all owe much to this game.
        Despite its incontestable historical significance, Half-Life is definitely a bit dated to the contemporary gamer. Like so many late 90s 3D games, it's graphics look chunky. It also doesn't control as smoothly as a contemporary FPS, making sections of the game with platforming challenges a bit annoying. Developers have since accepted that platforming in a first-person perspective is difficult to get right. It's hard to tell exactly where you're standing in Half-Life, meaning sometimes you might fall off a ledge even if your trying to be careful. Shooting is also not quite as smooth as a contemporary FPS, though it holds up fairly well. The brown gun site is a bit frustrating to work with as it tends to blend in to the environment of the game, making it hard to see exactly where you're shooting.
        Many of the game's original strengths are also still evident. Interesting enemies, creative environmental designs, and of course, the game's unique sense of continuity. One can certainly see why Half-Life was such a game-changer back in the day, even though the gameplay feels coarse by current standards. Half-Life presents an interesting setting, especially in the final levels of the game, which are by far the most bizarre and beautiful.
        If you are interested in the history of videogames, you should definitely try this game. If your looking for a fun FPS, you might be better off with something more recent. If your willing to forgive what's dated about the game and overlook some of it's flaws though, Half-Life still offers a journey worth taking.

I really don't know where to start... Half-Life is a real masterpiece. It's a piece of art, I would use it as an example of how an fps or even a videogame should be done. Playing this title for the first time was an experience I'm sure no other title will ever make me pass through. It's a must play, even if you don't like fps please try this one.

The graphics were astonishing back in those days and still okay even now since they are very clear with good definition.
It offers a nice storyline, including: zombies, aliens, blood, blood and more blood. If you are a sci-fi lover you are definetely going to like this game.
I personally liked the sensation of lonelyness you get at certain point. 

This game is one of the best videogames ever made and I'm not the only one saying that. It represents a good part of my childhood and it's one of the reasons of my pc addiction. It goes further to the literature field and marks the end and the beginning of an era.

Half-Life is more than just a videogame, it's a symbol, and for that I will give this one 10/10
Gordon Freeman

I always heard a lot about Freeman and the cult following for the Half-Life series, thinking what am I missing out on? Half-Life 1 at its core is a first person shooter, the story is there but you have to really listen to what npcs are saying to you (sounds were not balanced out) to understand what is going on (If not, you'll get the main idea eventually). You don't know too much about Freeman such as backstory or character development you see in games today but, I was taken by surprise to see that there is strategy (obstacles and puzzles/unique enemies) and unique design (later end of the game looks great) in all the areas you need to clear to advance through the levels. The game is more about the journey and gameplay then the character progression and story line which isn't as bad as it sounds. I have never played a first person shooter like this. ORIGINAL as can be. As a fan of 90's PC shooters, this a must have. Why are you still reading this? BUY IT!

Sometimes Half-Life kicks your ass as rather hard FPS (especially if you're playing on Hard difficulty) and sometimes it frustrates you a lot.

Shooting at spec ops team is freaking fun, as they're smart and viable - they cover each other and maneuver a lot. Unfortunately, most of your enemies are monsters, which are not that great at targeting you. So, it's kinda boring shooter till appearance of soldiers.

Frustration comes when you deal with all the rest - damn first-person platforming, unnatural to perform on keyboard crouch/long jumping, and scripted puzzles solved by just wandering around a level map. But they are really needed for creation of all that great atmosphere and breaks between shooting.

Still, Half-Life is great game, because it isn't yet another FPS. It is a wonderful story about physicist trying to get out of hell while launching rockets, repairing electricity and making his way through chemical dump.

One of the most important first-person shooters to enter the world of gaming, Valve's 'Half-Life' was the next step in evolution for the genre, before Halo: Combat Evolved and after John Carmack's DOOM. Even years later with outdated graphics the game still holds up as one of the most exciting, bone chilling, and best ways to tell a first-person story, starring Dr. Gordon Freeman as the ultimate gaming badass. So many weapons to choose from, intricate and clever level design, an awesome final boss, and tons of replayability, Half-Life is not a recommendation, but a requirement for the PC gamer to experience. An unforgettable classic.
Such a great game! Fun, intense and at the time a revolutionary game..... this still holds true today. If you have not played this classic what are you doing?

I'm sure it was great before Half-Life 2. After HL2, however, it's about as mediocre as it's arsenal of NPC models.

Headcrabs seemingly impossible to target.
Zombies don't do anything when you repeatedly attack them.
Vortigaunts will destroy you no matter what.
Character moves so fast, the shift key actually slows him down.
Boxes blocked by dead enemies?
I could have sworn I met Dr. Kleiner at least a dozen times before the resonance cascade.

Again, I'm sure it was amazing for 1999. Really should be offered for free at this point. I'd rather pay for Team Fortress 2 than this.

Honestly, what can I say about Half-Life? Similar to games like Doom, Quake from the developer id Software, it brought survival horror together with first-person-shooter mechanics and was an impressive game for it's time and even now regardless of the dated graphics. 
Personally, even though we will never get the almighty Gaben to make a third installment soon, I would still suggest this game especially to those who completely overlooked it due to its age and just went straight to HL2, and it's add-on episodes (where we never got episode 3 because Gaben wanted to DotA 2 instead). 

tl;dr Half-Life is a great game even with the outdated graphics, but if that bothers you go download the third party remake of the original game, Black Mesa if you're on PC, but if you just want to witness Valve's early days, BUY IT NOW BUY IT NOW.

What's the first thing that comes to mind, when reviewing a video game? Well, for me, it has to be the visual world that captures the core of our imaginations. And with this little gem called Half-Life, it comes as no exception that this game continues to boggle the mind and leave gamers alike wondering. There is more heart, creativity and scientific ingenuity there is in this one title than there is in most series and is arguably Valve's greatest achievement. With over 50 game awards, it's a strong justification. Half-Life isn't just one of the greatest FPS' games of all time. Half-Life isn't literally one of the best purchases you can ever get on Steam. Half-Life is quite simply, one of the greatest games ever made.

When compared to certain FPS' games in the past and todays time, which both heavily rely on long-winded cutscenes to present the main narrative of the game, Half-Life annihilates this often compulsed aspect, by detailing the plotlines that keeps the player still in control of the first-person viewpoint, leaving the cutscenes rolling while you still have full access to the gameplay and character controllability. For summarization, You will see through the eyes of Gordon Freeman at all times.

The game is a perpetual maze; leaving the player to work at tasks that involve being locked into battle and overall puzzle solving to advance through the many challenges that wait up ahead. Most of the time, the story illuminates the puzzles by the actions to proceed, such as maze scenarios and building boxes to use as staircases. Although Half-Life has short-lived loading screens from time to time after leaving a certain area for a new one, the game has no levels. But, to make up for this traditional concept, the game is split into a number of mind-boggling chapters filled with rich story and easy adaptability.

To start off with this game's story, you're none other than Gordon Freeman. A young man who holds a Ph.D in theoretical physics who starts his daily grind back at the Black Mesa Research Facility; a fictional complex that is stranded in a remote desert located in the suburbs of New Mexico. Arriving late for work yet again, you take the tram system around the Black Mesa Research Facility and at this point, objectives that his game has fulfilled such as breath-taking visuals and movie quality animation begins to blossom. The tram sequence at the beginning of the game can only be summed up in one word; Incredible. It's as if the things that come flying at you from every angle and position, almost reminiscent of watching an action-packed movie, along with the credits of the producer's names proudly fading in and out on the corner of the screen.

As you make your first step in the heavily secured facility, you're constantly reminded that you put on your Hazardous Environmental suit, or the H.E.V suit for short. While all things are hunky-dory, those things soon turn to the worst very soon. After a failed experiment, involving a collision between a rare intergalactic specimen from another dimension with an Anti-Mass Spectrometer, the Black Mesa facility falls in ruins, meaning you are one of the only key survivors of the infamous ''Black Mesa Incident''. And with this, alien life-forms from the dimension of ''Xen'' are pulled from their dimension into ours and are running amok the ruined facility, along with the Army that storm the place after the gone, haywired facility's emergency call has been echoed. This of course doesn't make things any easier and you soon find yourself battling both the aliens and the military.

While there isn't exactly much to complain about, I would admit that guiding the chickened-out scientists and professors around the facility can be quite a pain now and again due to some seldom poor AI programming, as well as the alien life-form, Vortigaunt, from which you would have to wait and be patient for them to wreck down wooden doors in front of you, as you are not capable of doing that yourself. (You do start off with a crowbar, right?) As well as I'm probably not the only one who made the same mistake by killing them through a small opening, before they did in fact begin to tear down the doors. But then again, this is where the used scripted intermissions started to show, so that's an added bonus to the magnitude of the game.

For the long run, I've had fun and joy both reviewing this amazing game and playing this amazing game. If you haven't play Half-Life or even worse, not familiar with Half-Life, it's still a big compulsory  recommendation from me.

В 1998 году американская компания-разработчик компьютерных игр Valve преподнесла игрокам шедевр в прямом мысле этого слова. Именно игра, которая получила название, которое впало в душу многим геймерам - Half-Life, именно она стала прорывом в истории игр, ведь она и по сей день сводит с ума всех геймеров планеты, позже ставшая классикой своего жанра. Глубокий сюжет, приличная графика по тем временам, разнообразие врагов, огромные локации - всё это сделало из обычной игры настоящее произведение искусcтва в истории игровой индустрии. Даже на уровне сложности легко, всё было не так то просто, ничто не давало расслабиться геймерам, и на это есть причины: огромное количество врагов, места где главному герою нужно "изловчиться", места где надо напрячь свои извилины (при условии если они имеются, хотя бы одна). Именно продолжение ЭТОЙ серии игр многие ждут и по сей день. Данная игра набрала тысячи фанатов по всей планете, привела Valve к успеху, и именно она дала начало другим великолемным играм, кто играл в эту великую игру поймёт о чём я повествую, ну а кто не играл, чтож... Вы многое потеряли ведь это не просто игра - это целая вселенная. Вообщем покупайте, играйте - не пожалеете!

Singular Life is probably one of the most normal games I've ever played. You could have called it School Simulator based on the way the physics and heavy scripted sequences play out, because its all the same shit over and over and over and over and over and over and beginning and over and middle and end and thesis statement and supporting evidence and over and introduction and conclusions. That's how I feel when I play That 70s Show: The Video Game. However the one thing that makes this game stand apart from the other god awful shit-faced genre we've come to know as "dunkstin checks in baddadum baddadum dunkstin checks in", is in-game Youtube Browser and Video Downloader. It makes stealing other youtuber's content for reupload easier than ever before! Like, I have NO IDEA how I ever would have made it to the point in my youtube career I am at now without this game. Anyways, I guess this game is OKAY if you compare it to LoL or Wolfenstein 3D, but what it comes down to, is Fozilla Mirefox is a better game and it comes with a Twitch stealer that can rebroadcast other peoples twitch streams so that you can get the revenue. I give Rapist's Delight a very good 8.5/10.
can be frustrating but is very enjoyable to figure out the best way to go about a level. refreshingly simple and immersive
it is very good game i enjoyed playing it the story of the half life series is epic =)

Yes this game is a classic, and yes it has its merits. However, by today's standards this game is a bit of a mess and I wasn't having a whole bunch of fun. A tad unfortunate but oh well. I guess we'll just have to wait for Half Life 3...
revisited this game after playing it as a youngin. Still good fun, why not check out the game that started it all for valve and spawned teamfortress and counter strike game modes
Nothing is wrong with game they did it right the frist time.
This is a very retro style game from the late 90's. Phenomenal game that reminds me a lot of Medal of Honor from back in the day. This was a good buy. Can't wait to finish the game.

This is the ultimate 'save game' button spamming simulator with disturbing foes and a little insect problem.
It's also very long and gets boring fast. Half-Life also has an incredibly repetitious gameplay. Also has a lack of zombies. Yeh really. There's a lot of headcrabs in the game but only a couple of zombies. I guess that's Valve logic but whatever. Also has a couple of really confusing moments and puzzles btw.

If you can stand old games and their textures + that stupidly repetitious gameplay this the game for you.

Oh and you can also shoot things. Pretty neat. I actually bought this because my History teacher recommended. That's kinda interesting actually. What are you waiting for? Buy the game and be ready for a really long and boring adventure throught some random sciense lab.

Amazing game. The Graphics I love even to this day. The Blood and Gore are extravogant in how a person will explode to peices 
in just a matter of seconds (this could be considered a pro or con depending on the person). The game is really fun, can be frustrating, and is full of energy and life. You will NEVER get tired of it. I highly recommend this game, I have absolutely no quarral with this game and have never found a true con. The only mistakes in this game are made by the player.
Ein Klassiker. Wer es nicht gespielt hat, sollte das unbedingt nachholen!
Классика. Всеми любимая классика
